snippet: As protesters gathered again in Moscow, their movement collided with its own limitations and Vladimir V. Putin’s decisive victory in Russia’s presidential vote.
abstract: Thousands of people throng a concourse along a main street in Moscow to denounce President-elect Vladimir V Putin and to call for political freedom; they wear white ribbons in a sign of unity and chant now-familiar refrains 'Russia without Putin' and 'Russia will be free'.

byline.original: By DAVID M. HERSZENHORN and ELLEN BARRY
byline.contributor: Andrew E. Kramer, Michael Schwirtz and Anastasia Sadovskaya contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: As protesters gathered again in Moscow, their movement collided with its own limitations and Vladimir V. Putin’s decisive victory in Russia’s presidential vote.

headline.seo: Anti-Putin Protests Appear to Be Losing Steam
headline.main: Anti-Putin Protesters Struggle to Keep Up Steam
headline.print_headline: Anti-Putin Protesters Struggle to Keep Winter Outbursts From Losing Steam
